contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Vilppula.sijainti.suomi.2008.svg|thumb|right|180px|Location of Vilppula in [[Finland]]]] '''Vilppula''' is a [[List of former municipalities of Finland|former municipality]] of [[Finland]]. Neighbouring [[Mänttä]] was merged into it on 1 January 2009 to form the municipality of [[Mänttä-Vilppula]]. It was located in the [[provinces of Finland|province]] of [[Western Finland]] and was part of the [[Pirkanmaa]] [[regions of Finland|region]]. The municipality had a population of 5,457 in 2005 and covered an area of 571.26 km² of which 99.90 km² was water. The [[population density]] was 10.5 inhabitants per km². The work force was mainly of industry and service, these accounting for 50 and 39 percent of total workforce. Population was estimated to be in a slight decline. [[Kolho]] village in Vilppula is located north to centrum. Another village, [[Pohjaslahti]], is located northwest from the Vilppula centre. These continue to exist as villages of the new Mänttä-Vilppula municipality. The municipality was unilingually [[Finnish language|Finnish]]. ==External links== {{commonscat-inline|Vilppula}} *[http://www.manttavilppula.fi/ Mänttä-Vilppula] – Official site {{Pirkanmaa}} {{coord|62|01|20|N|24|30|35|E|region:FI_type:city(5458)_scale:50000|display=title}} [[Category:Populated places disestablished in 2009]] [[Category:Former municipalities of Finland]] [[Category:Mänttä-Vilppula]] {{WesternFinland-geo-stub}}
